sections.title: Domain Mapping Introduction
sections.txt_claim: This document outlines cross-domain deployment applications for the Protopraxic Logic System.
sections.notes: Introductory statement. Interpretive document describing applications, not formal proofs.

sections.title: 1. Theology Domain
sections.txt_claim: Coherent trinitarian metaphysics (ùïÄ‚ÇÅ, ùïÄ‚ÇÇ, ùïÄ‚ÇÉ); Model divine attributes: truth, love, glory; Exclude incoherent theological models (strict monism, modalism)
sections.notes: Interpretive application domain. No formal proofs of theological claims exist in proof_index.json. Conceptual framework only.

sections.title: 2. Metaphysics Domain
sections.txt_claim: Necessity grounded in interdependent identities; Filters contingent vs essential attributes; Eliminates brute facts via modal entailment and triune grounding
sections.notes: Interpretive application domain. Claims about 'eliminating brute facts' are conceptual, not formally proven. No proof IDs exist for metaphysical necessity claims.

sections.title: 3. Epistemology Domain
sections.txt_claim: Coherence theory of truth formalized via ‚ßü, ‚áå, ‚©™; Knowledge: ‚ñ°(Belief ‚àß Grounded ‚àß Coherent); Rejects relativistic models lacking modal coherence
sections.notes: Interpretive application domain. Claims about 'coherence theory of truth' and knowledge definition are conceptual proposals, not formal proofs. No epistemic theorems exist in proof_index.json.

sections.title: 4. Ethics Domain
sections.txt_claim: Goodness = identity-preserving coherence (‚ßü); Evil = ‚àºCoherence = Privation; Moral realism derivable via ‚ñ°(ùïÜ ‚üº Good)
sections.notes: Interpretive application domain. Claims about goodness, evil, and moral realism are conceptual. No ethical theorems exist in proof_index.json. 'Derivable' claim unsupported by formal proof.

sections.title: 5. Aesthetics Domain
sections.txt_claim: Beauty = modal balance (‚áå); Fragmentation ‚Üí aesthetic incoherence ‚Üí evaluative decay; Groundable beauty defined as that which instantiates triune harmony
sections.notes: Interpretive application domain. Claims about beauty and aesthetic properties are conceptual. No aesthetic theorems exist in proof_index.json.

sections.title: 6. Logic Systems Domain
sections.txt_claim: Completes gaps left in classical logic (LEM, contradiction scope); Distinct symbol set prevents category bleed with Aristotelian/MF logics; Suitable as a coherence-checking overlay for any modal predicate domain
sections.notes: Interpretive application domain. Claim about 'completing gaps in classical logic' refers to LEM being proven (pxl_internal_lem exists), but broader claim about 'coherence-checking overlay' is conceptual application, not formal theorem.
